page.title: 02PROPERTY AND PRICES
page.content: As a result of the oil boom the west end of Aberdeen is one of the most expensive housing areas not only within the City but within Britain.The houses are built of granite.Typical house styles are tenements,large terraced houses,detached villas,and bungalows.A survey at Aberdeen Solicitor's Property Centre 7/6/85 revealed that the average asking price for two apartment renovated tenement flats was Â£25.000.Most of the large detached houses along Albyn Place, Carden Place,Queen's Road have been converted into oil related offices, doctor's surgeries,hotels and law offices owing to the prestigious nature of the buildings and the ease of parking.As this is a designated Conservation Area developers must conform to certain planning regulations and standards.
